text: 1932 advertisement Congorilla (1932) is a documentary film by Martin and Osa Johnson. The film follows the couple through Africa as they encounter animals that they characterize as threatening before a lengthy sequence with the couple with a pygmy community. This sequence is notorious for its racism and condescension towards the African people. It is considered one of the earliest ethnographic documentary films. ==References== Category:1932 documentary films Category:1932 films Category:American documentary films Category:American films Category:Documentary films about Africa Category:American black-and- white films
